column2: JavaScript is a programming language that enables interactivity and dynamic functionality on websites.

column1: How can I include an external JavaScript file?
column2: You can include an external JavaScript file in your HTML using the <script> tag with the src attribute.

column1: What is the difference between == and ===?
column2: The == operator compares only the values of the variables
column3: while the === operator compares both the values and types of the variables.

column1: What is the difference between null and undefined?
column2: Null is an explicit assignment of a non-value
column3: while undefined is an implicit assignment of a non-value.

column1: What is the difference between a function declaration and a function expression?
column2: A function declaration is hoisted to the top of the scope in which it is defined
column3: while a function expression is not.

column1: What is the difference between a parameter and an argument?
column2: A parameter is a variable in a function definition
column3: while an argument is the value passed to a function when it is invoked.

column1: What is the difference between a method and a function?
column2: A method is a function that is a property of an object
column3: while a function is a property of the global object.

column1: What is the difference between call and apply?
column2: The call method takes in arguments separately
column3: while the apply method takes in arguments as an array.

column1: What is the difference between a named function and an anonymous function?
column2: A named function has a name
column3: while an anonymous function does not.

column1: What is the difference between a function expression and an IIFE?
column2: A function expression is a function that is assigned to a variable
column3: while an IIFE is a function that is immediately invoked.

column1: What is the difference between a for loop and a while loop?
column2: A for loop is used to iterate over a range of values
column3: while a while loop is used to iterate over a range of values until a condition is met.

column1: What is the difference between a for loop and a for-in loop?
column2: A for loop is used to iterate over a range of values
column3: while a for-in loop is used to iterate over the properties of an object.

column1: What is the difference between a while loop and a do-while loop?
column2: A while loop checks the condition before executing the code
column3: while a do-while loop executes the code before checking the condition.
